org.apache.hadoop.hbase.client

类 HRegionLocator

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.hadoop.hbase.client.HRegionLocator
  • 所有已实现的接口:
    Closeable, AutoCloseable, RegionLocator

    @InterfaceAudience.Private
 @InterfaceStability.Stable
public class HRegionLocator
extends Object
implements RegionLocator
    An implementation of RegionLocator. Used to view region location information for a single HBase table. Lightweight. Get as needed and just close when done. Instances of this class SHOULD NOT be constructed directly. Obtain an instance via Connection. See ConnectionFactory class comment for an example of how.

    This class is thread safe

      • getRegionLocation

        public HRegionLocation getRegionLocation(byte[] row)
                                  throws IOException
        Finds the region on which the given row is being served. Does not reload the cache.
        指定者:
        getRegionLocation 在接口中 RegionLocator
        参数:
        row - Row to find.
        返回:
        Location of the row.
        抛出:
        IOException - if a remote or network exception occurs

      • getRegionLocation

        public HRegionLocation getRegionLocation(byte[] row,
                                         boolean reload)
                                  throws IOException
        Finds the region on which the given row is being served.
        指定者:
        getRegionLocation 在接口中 RegionLocator
        参数:
        row - Row to find.
        reload - true to reload information or false to use cached information
        返回:
        Location of the row.
        抛出:
        IOException - if a remote or network exception occurs

      • getStartKeys

        public byte[][] getStartKeys()
                      throws IOException
        Gets the starting row key for every region in the currently open table.

        This is mainly useful for the MapReduce integration.

        指定者:
        getStartKeys 在接口中 RegionLocator
        返回:
        Array of region starting row keys
        抛出:
        IOException - if a remote or network exception occurs

      • getEndKeys

        public Pair<byte[][],byte[][]> getStartEndKeys()
